show.title: Trick 'r Treat
show.headline: Poison, Drowning, Claw, Or Knife. So Many Ways To Take A Life.

event.title: <show-title>Trick 'r Treat</show-title>
event.headline: Poison, Drowning, Claw, Or Knife. So Many Ways To Take A Life.
event.description: Before Michael Doughtery was scarring Christmas memories with his holiday horror classic KRAMPUS or ushering in kaiju carnage in GODZILLA: KING OF THE MONSTERS, the writer/director burst into the hearts of horror fans with his Halloween-based anthology TRICK ‘R TREAT. Weaving together stories about killers, monsters, ghosts and ghouls, Doughtery’s movie is a tongue-in-cheek, gleefully scary celebration of the season that stars Anna Paquin, Brian Cox, Dylan Baker and a pumpkin-headed lil’ monster named Sam.

show.title: Elf
show.headline: The best way to spread Christmas cheer

event.title: <show-title>Elf</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: With themed games, props, and singing loud for all to hear
event.description:
"Buddy the Elf, what's your favorite color?"

Don’t be a cotton-headed ninnymuggins this holiday season. Come out to Alamo Drafthouse and spread the cheer at this sugar-fueled, interactive holiday spectacular, packed with games, props, and, of course, singing loud for all to hear.

Bundle up for this celebration of one of the best holiday films ever made, period. Will Ferrell’s take on a North Pole elf trying to figure out Manhattan (“Watch out! The yellow ones don’t stop!”) just might be the funniest he’s ever been.

Our ELF Movie Party features all sorts of fun props, a gift "wrap off" before the film, and of course, your very own elf hat.

show.title: Shaun of the Dead
show.headline: Prime the pump for Edgar Wright's newest with his zom-rom-com

event.title: <show-title>Shaun of the Dead</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: How's this for a slice of fried gold?
event.description:
When SHAUN OF THE DEAD first came out, it was instantly recognizable as a cult classic in the making. With its hilariously quotable dialogue, gory action, and genuinely endearing characters, it has inspired a whole genre of ZomRomComs in the intervening years.

So to celebrate the film that launched Simon Pegg, Nick Frost, and Edgar Wright into superstardom, we’re throwing a splat-tacular Movie Party. We'll provide inflatable cricket bats so you can smack your neighbor every time Shaun smacks a zombie onscreen, and your very own Shaun-esque name tag.

While you can’t smoke at Alamo Drafthouse, it’s still a pretty decent place to hole up for a couple of hours and wait for this whole thing to blow over.

show.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
show.headline: Nothing but the best for the Griswold Family Christmas

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Beverly D'Angelo and Chevy Chase in National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

portraitHeroImage.altText: Chevy Chase in National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation

posterImages.altText: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation movie poster

event.title: <show-title>National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Celebrate the season like an honorary Griswold.
event.description:
No one knows how to do vacations like the Griswolds. Sure, their holidays are wild, chaotic, and often fraught with peril, but everyone’s family gatherings are a little stressful, aren’t they? Fortunately, you can just let Clark and the gang shoulder all that stress while you enjoy the ride at our CHRISTMAS VACATION Movie Party.

We’re giving it the full Movie Party treatment, with special props like pine tree air fresheners, yellow glowsticks, and ugly neckties to help you feel like you're an honorary Griswold. It’ll be more fun than a membership to the Jelly of the Month Club.

show.title: The Rocky Horror Picture Show
show.headline: Do the time warp with us, again

landscapeHeroImage.altText: Id G Af Zk98u Bki Y4 R1q O5fnacan W

event.title: <show-title>The Rocky Horror Picture Show</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Don’t dream it, be it… at our ROCKY HORROR Movie Party.
event.description:
Now, at long last, the antici.....pation is over! As the cult of ROCKY HORROR enters its fourth decade, Alamo Drafthouse's 21st-century celebration of this pioneer of interactive movies has incorporated new breakthroughs, elusive ingredients, and that... SPARK, which will make the RHPS experience better than ever!

Now, we know that some ROCKY HORROR screenings can become a little too focused on yelling out those callbacks, so our hosts will make sure we strike a good balance between having some interactive fun while also allowing everyone to enjoy the movie on its own terms.

But we also know that the key to the perfect ROCKY HORROR screening is to have fun and live the movie. With thrilling props, the most outrageous callbacks, boisterous sing-alongs, and stimulating pre-show games, our Movie Party will be your ultimate ROCKY HORROR PICTURE SHOW – whether this is your first or 500th viewing.

posterImage.altText: Rocky horror picture show poster mp

show.title: The Guest
show.headline: Be careful who you let in.

event.title: <show-title>The Guest</show-title>
event.headline: Be careful who you let in.
event.description: Adam Wingard's genre-bending film is an incredibly fun '80s throwback that feels like a CAPTAIN AMERICA film from hell. The movie - starring Dan Stevens as a super soldier who worms his way into the lives of the family of a man killed while serving in the military - pays homage to a litany of great ‘80s action films without ever sliding into camp. Featuring amazing music, sly humor, and a great pace, THE GUEST is the horror-action banger you've been waiting for your whole life.

show.title: Gremlins
show.headline: Your favorite little monsters invade Christmas, yet again

event.title: <show-title>Gremlins</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: Wreak havoc mogwai-style at a fun, interactive screening
event.description:
Joe Dante’s GREMLINS continues to be a pop culture sensation, with its darkly funny story of a small-town guy who receives a furry little creature called a mogwai that ends up multiplying into a swarm of monsters who rip the town to shreds. Frankly, wanton destruction has never been so fun.

At our GREMLINS Movie Party, we won’t let you tear the place apart or ruin our electronics, but we will have all kinds of fun props available to help you get in on the action, including paper plates to throw around during the kitchen fight, and masks so you can choose #TeamSpike or #TeamGizmo.

We just ask that you follow these few simple rules:

- Don’t get a mogwai wet.
- Don’t expose a mogwai to bright light.
- Don’t feed a mogwai after midnight.
- Don’t miss our GREMLINS Movie Party.

show.title: The Polar Express
show.headline: Journey beyond your imagination in this holiday family favorite

event.title: <show-title>The Polar Express</show-title> <event-type-title>Movie Party</event-type-title>
event.headline: An interactive holiday activity the whole family will love
event.description:
Tickets, please. You can’t attend THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party without your ticket. And believe us when we tell you that the conductor (one of many Tom Hankses in this movie) is very particular about it.

Once you and the kiddos come aboard this special holiday Movie Party, we’ll have all sorts of fun surprises waiting for you, including kid-friendly props like a Santa hat, sleigh bells, and some fun activity sheets for you to take home. (And don’t worry, parents, we’ll be sure to lay down some ground rules so you’re not having to listen to jingle bells the whole time.)

With fun props, tasty treats, and more Tom Hankses than you can shake a candy cane at, THE POLAR EXPRESS Movie Party is a delightful, interactive holiday activity the whole family will love.

show.title: Psycho (1960)
show.headline: The Hitchcock horror classic

event.title: <show-title>Psycho (1960)</show-title>
event.headline: The Hitchcock horror classic
event.description:
Featuring a special video intro from “you’re favorite ghoul-friend” Peaches Christ where she analyzes the queer sub- and super-text of each film that she hand-picked herself!

Where would we be without PSYCHO?

Sixty years on and Hitchcock’s delicious cod-Freudian nightmare about a platinum-blonde embezzler (Janet Leigh) who neglected to consult a guide before selecting her motel still has much to answer for. It blazed a bloody trail for the much-loved slasher cycle, but it also assured us that a B-movie could be A-grade in quality and innovation. It dared to suggest that your star didn’t need to surface from an ordeal smelling of roses (or, indeed, at all). It combined a knife, a scream, a melon, some chocolate sauce, Bernard Herrmann’s greatest score, and more than 70 edits to push the envelope of screen violence. It lent The Simpsons some of its best gags. It offers perfect case studies of suspense, paranoia, and montage for lazy film-studies tutors. And, of course, it was the first movie to show a toilet flushing, so we might also credit it with spawning the entire gross-out genre. PSYCHO: We salute you. (David Jenkins, Time Out)

show.title: Lady Snowblood
show.headline: A beautiful young woman is trained from birth to be an instrument of revenge

event.title: <show-title>Lady Snowblood</show-title>
event.headline: A beautiful young woman is trained from birth to be an instrument of revenge
event.description: Gory revenge is raised to the level of visual poetry in Toshiya Fujita’s stunning LADY SNOWBLOOD. A major inspiration for Quentin Tarantino’s Kill Bill saga, this endlessly inventive film, set in late nineteenth-century Japan, charts the single-minded path of vengeance taken by a young woman (Meiko Kaji) whose parents were the unfortunate victims of a gang of brutal criminals. Fujita creates a wildly entertaining action film of remarkable craft, an effortless balancing act between beauty and violence.

show.title: The Roku Channel Presents: Weird: The Al Yankovic Story
show.headline: The world belongs to the weird

portraitHeroImage.altText: Daniel Radcliffe in Weird: The Al Yankovic Story

posterImages.altText: Weird: The Al Yankovic Story movie poster

event.title: <show-title>The Roku Channel Presents: Weird: The Al Yankovic Story</show-title> <event-type-title>w/Livestream Q&A</event-type-title>
event.headline: The world belongs to the WEIRD
event.description:
Join us for the live-streamed premiere of WEIRD: THE AL YANKOVIC STORY. This is your one shot to see the (somewhat) true story of your favorite accordion player and an A-list cast of thousands their agents won't let us reveal for one day only before it hits The Roku Channel on November 4th. And it’s free, how WEIRD is that? Enjoy a live-streamed red carpet and Q&A with the cast, free props, and themed food and drinks. Save your seat now with a food and beverage voucher. Seats are limited and available on a first-come, first-serve basis.

Roku, Inc. and its affiliates have no responsibility or liability in connection with any loss or accident, including death or contracting of illness, incurred in connection with use of an invite. Roku, Inc. and its affiliates are not responsible if, for any reason, a guest is unable to attend in whole or in part; or for lost, delayed or misdirected vouchers. All federal, state, and local regulations apply.

WEIRD: THE AL YANKOVIC STORY

Daniel Radcliffe is "Weird Al" Yankovic in the unexaggerated true story about the greatest musician of our time. From a conventional upbringing where playing the accordion was a sin, Al rebelled and made his dream of changing the words to world-renowned songs come true. An instant success and sex symbol, Al lives an excessive lifestyle and pursues an infamous romance that nearly destroys him. With Evan Rachel Wood, Rainn Wilson, and an A-list cast of thousands their agents won't let us reveal.

show.title: Tokyo Godfathers (Dubbed)

show.title: Enter the Dragon
show.headline: The ultimate in martial arts adventure and excitement!

event.title: <show-title>Enter the Dragon</show-title>
event.headline: The ultimate in martial arts adventure and excitement
event.description:
ENTER THE DRAGON is the dominantly influential and classic Bruce Lee martial arts masterpiece that spawned a thousand and one sequels, requels, remakes, spoofs, homages, and straight-up "Bruceploitation" rip-offs.

Robert Clouse directs Lee in what would sadly be his last completed feature film role before his untimely and mysterious death in 1973. The result is a spectre of the cinema, a towering, wholly breathtaking persona who resonates onscreen with vibrancy and vitality, supported by co-stars John Saxon (Roper) and Jim Kelly (Williams).

Lee goes undercover by way of an invitation to a martial arts tournament on a secluded island, hosted by an unsavory, suspected crime boss. As Lee discovers an underbelly of corruption and prostitution, his cover is blown and two fellow tournament competitors (Roper and Williams) must fight not for sport, but instead for survival.

event.title: <show-title>Casablanca</show-title> <event-type-title>Brunch</event-type-title>
event.headline: The Hollywood classic that gets better and better "As Time Goes By."
event.description: Order from our tasty brunch menu – Egg BLT, French Toast, or Breakfast Tacos – and pair with a brunch cocktail classic like Desert Spring Water or the Italian 75. Each are available to order along with our full menu at this special brunch screening.

eventType.title: Special Menu
eventType.headline: Sink your teeth into your favorite films
eventType.description: From STAR WARS-themed milkshakes to twelve-hour LORD OF THE RINGS marathon feasts, our chefs whip up movie-inspired specials that’s like nothing else you’ve ever experienced.

event.description: Save your seat for a special advance screening of PLEASE BABY PLEASE, a fantasia of flamboyant masculinity and queer desire from director Amanda Kramer.

marketStrings.value: The personal closed captioning device displays feature film dialogue and other audio in the form of English-language text for individuals who are deaf or hard of hearing.

The descriptive audio headset provides individuals who are blind or have low vision with an English-language narration of the details of the feature presentation that can't be understood by the soundtrack alone.

The assisted listening headset provides an amplified audio signal for those individuals who are hard of hearing. A 3.5mm headphone jack is available to drive hearing aids, neck loops, or cochlear implants.
You may not enter a movie after it has started. If you show up to your desired screening late, we will happily exchange your ticket for a different showtime or for a raincheck to a future show.

sessionAttributes.name: All Ages
sessionAttributes.description: Get ready for maximum family fun! Our All Ages screenings include pre-show activity sheets and crayons, a relaxed noise policy, kids menus, and a free prize for kids 12 and under. All ages welcome with a parent or guardian.

sessionAttributes.name: Brunch
sessionAttributes.description: Both our regular and Brunch menus are available at this screening. Arrive hungry.

sessionAttributes.name: Sensory Friendly
sessionAttributes.description: Our all-inclusive screenings welcome babies, infants, nursing moms, and guests with Autism and other sensory needs. Sound will be quieter. Theater will be a little less dark. Chatter, walking around, and babies being babies are A-OK.

formats.title: 2D Digital
formats.headline: Digital format projected using a digital projector.
formats.description: Digital format projected using a digital projector.

formats.title: 3D Digital
formats.headline: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!
formats.description: All the digitalness of the Digital 2D format, but with an extra dimension!

formats.title: Open Caption
formats.headline: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.
formats.description: Captioning will be displayed on the screen for the duration of the show.

agePolicies.name: All Ages
agePolicies.description: All ages including babies are welcome with parent or guardian.

agePolicies.name: Rated G
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG
agePolicies.description: Guests under 18 must be accompanied by an adult. Children 3 and up allowed for shows that start before 6pm. Ages 6 and up after 6pm.

agePolicies.name: Rated PG-13 (Standard) (1701)
agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.

agePolicies.description: 18 and up. Guests ages 6-17 are welcome any time with a parent or guardian.
